Learn how locals cultivate the coffee plants and harvest the bright red berries, before drying, charring, and brewing them to unleash notes of caramel and mango. The chocolate follows a similar process and allows you to find delicious hints of honey and vanilla as you sample the freshly made treat.

dayInfo.title: La Fortuna - Visit Volcanoes and Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: Venture into the wondrous Arenal Volcano National Park, where you can travel the trails weaving through lava fields and untouched tropical rainforest. The sharp, black rocks reveal the prescience of another eruption along the foothills of Arenal Volcano, while also demonstrating the rough texture of the dried magma. Your guide will then take you to a trail leading to the thundering La Fortuna Waterfall. You may hear the sound of the falls before you see the water tumbling nearly 200 feet into the azure pool below. The combination of magma and waterfalls embodies Costa Rica’s natural diversity and beauty.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde - Travel to the Cloud Forest
dayInfo.description: Traveling between La Fortuna and Arenal offers a scenic drive through jungle terrain to reach the exceptional cloud forest. When you reach the shores of Lake Arenal, you can board the boat bound for the opposite end. The panorama during the ride will open to views of the volcano at the center, jungle at its base, and the glassy waters of the lake in the foreground. You may find hints of rainbow bass or witness ornate hawk eagles circling the sky before reaching Monteverde for the remainder of the day. Here, you can relax in the comfort of your accommodation.

dayInfo.title: Monteverde - Discover the Beauty of the Cloud Forest
dayInfo.description: Exploring the Curi Cancha Reserve immerses you in the wonders of Costa Rica’s endless natural resources. In the cooler morning air, you may hear the three-wattled bellbird or catch a glimpse of the resplendent quetzal’s iridescent plumage glinting in the light passing through the tree canopy. With over 200 species of birds in the reserve, it can feel as though the animal kingdom comes to you as you wander along the serene forest trail. Your guide may point out two-toed sloths blending with the tree bark or you may hear the guttural call of howler monkeys from up to three miles away. You may continue your discovery of the forest in a more adventurous way as you take to the treetops on a zipline, enjoying the wind brushing against your cheeks as you fly through the air like a bird.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Travel to Panama City
dayInfo.description: Monteverde in the morning can feel like a treasure trove of untamed wilderness as the sounds of howler monkeys and birds fill the trees of the cloud forest. Your private transfer will meet you at the hotel and escort you back to San Jose’s airport for your flight to Panama City. The capital of Panama can feel like a metropolis after your time in the secluded comforts of the Costa Rican highlands, but the charming tropical ambiance blends easily with Spanish colonial architecture and the shimmering glass of modern high-rises. Your private transfer will lead you to your accommodation, where you can enjoy the remainder of the day at leisure.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Experience the Marvels of the Grand Canal
dayInfo.description: You can enjoy an immersive introduction to Panama City and remarkable history with a tour to Casco Viejo, the oldest neighborhood in the country’s capital. With foundations dating back to the 17th century, you can stroll with your guide along the cobblestone streets, enjoying colorful facades featuring preserved Spanish colonial architecture and vibrant plazas. You may find atoms of freshly brewed Panamanian coffee and bread pudding emanating from nearby cafes before you reach the Catedral Metropolitana or the towering walls and arches of Iglesia y Convento de la Compania de Jesus. You will continue to the Miraflores Locks to cruise a section of the 55-mile-long Panama Canal, where the water can rise or descend up to 54 feet to match the level of the next chamber.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Choose Your Panama City Adventure
dayInfo.description: With the day at your leisure, you can explore more of Panama City at your preferred pace. You may choose to revisit the Panama Canal for a more in-depth look at the engineering used to close the locks and raise or lower the waters as necessary, or stroll along the seaside promenade of Pase de la Bovedas to view artisan vendors and beautiful views. A tour of Monkey Island can get you up close to four species of monkey on a piece of land in the middle of Lake Gatun. The unique jungle terrain offers protection to the curious animals, including the precocious white-faced capuchin monkey, booming howler monkey, paternal lemurien owl monkey, and the fluffy Geoffroy’s Tamarin monkey.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Venture to the Celebrated Bocas del Toro
dayInfo.description: Bocas del Toro is an alluring collection of islands known for soft, white-sand beaches, crystal-clear waters, and tropical forests edging the coastline. You will have a private transfer to the airport for your flight and will eventually board a boat bound for Isla Bastimentos. While Isla Colon hums with an exciting rhythm, but relaxed pace, giving way to luxurious beaches and the swirling aromas of the sea breeze and Afro-Caribbean food, Isla Bastimentos can feel like a different world, even though it is only a 10-minute boat ride away. Palm trees edge the beach, sea turtles find perfect nesting grounds on the soft sands, and mangrove trees fade to the promise of colorful coral reefs protected by the national marine park. The remainder of the day can be spent relaxing on the secluded shores of your accommodation and enjoying the luxurious ambiance.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Delight in the Island at Leisure
dayInfo.description: With the day at your leisure, you can embrace the remote ambiance and relaxed pace of the island to revel in the soft sands where the golden sunlight heats the shoreline against the refreshing temperatures of the water. Lounge on the powdery yellow shores of Wizard Beach, with a backdrop of jungle vines, or venture to the wondrous Nivida Bat Cave. A subterranean lake sits beneath the nectar bats in the protected areas of the Isla Bastimentos national marine park. The boat ride to the cave takes you through an enchanting mangrove forest framed by lush vegetation. You may find caimans hiding among the vines as you pass in the water, before reaching a hiking trail leading to the cave’s mouth. The journey and the destination become an unforgettable adventure.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Explore Bocas del Toro at Your Pace
dayInfo.description: You have another day to embrace the quiet charms of Isla Bastimentos. Take to the sands of Polo Beach, where the sheltered cove offers pristine clarity for snorkeling, or kayak along the edges of the island to reach more dynamic snorkeling spots to view brain lettuce, eagle rays, and healthy Elkhorn coral. For a different perspective, you could venture to the island of Bocas to visit the Smithsonian Center for Tropical Research. The station offers extensive information on the region’s biodiversity and conservation research performed in the Caribbean to find colorful poison-dart frogs or elements of coral reef ecosystems.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Return to Panama City
dayInfo.description: When you are ready, you will return to Panama City and enjoy the remainder of the day in the country’s capital. You can take your time revisiting the charming streets of Casco Viejo or further explore the dynamic ruins of Panama Viejo, the original site of the former Spanish city dating back to the early 16th century. Fourteen ruins remain, including elements of the oldest Spanish bridge in the Americas, which dates back to 1617. The museum offers more information on the remains of the historical structures for a better perspective of what was versus what is left of the original settlement.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the streets of Panama City fill with life, as many start their day before the tropical heat sets in. The aromas of typical Panamanian coffee fill the streets of Casco Viejo with hints of peach and citrus. Cakes and cookies fill the windows of traditional and modern bakeries. Your private transfer will meet you at the hotel and escort you to the airport for your flight home, bringing an end to your exceptional exploration of Costa Rica and Panama.

tourName: Best of Panama Vacation Package: Tropical Beach, Islands, and More
placesVisited: Panama City, Monkey Island, Boquete, Isla Colon, Bocas del Toro, Isla Bastimentos
generalInfo: Your 9-day Panama Highlights tour immerses you in the splendors of the jungle and tropical coastline as you explore and experience the depth of natural beauty, rich history, and adventure across the country. From the Panama Canal to Spanish colonial architecture, powdery white-sand beaches to captivating wildlife, the highlights of Panama embody the remarkable diversity of experiences you can enjoy while creating timeless memories.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Arrive in the Beauty of Panama City
dayInfo.description: Panama City is a whirlwind of contemporary culture and colonial history, tropical weather, and modern architecture connecting to the marvels of the Panama Canal. The diverse landscape touches lush jungle terrain, serene coastline, and chic shopping districts for a variety of adventures to enjoy across the city. You will arrive at the airport, where your transfer will meet you at customs and escort you to the comforts of your centrally located accommodations. The remainder of the day is yours to settle into Panama City at your leisure. Whether enjoying a visit to the Museo de Sitio Panama Viejo for a deeper look at the scale of Spanish settlement in the 17th century or walking the coastal avenue of Paseo de las Bovedas to enjoy a view of the water opposite the collection of artisans showcasing their craftsmanship, you can embrace the ambiance at your pace.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Journey on the Panama Canal
dayInfo.description: The Panama Canal is one of the contemporary world’s most famous feats of engineering. After breakfast, you will have a partial tour with a cruise traveling through a portion of the waterway and famous locks. As you step onto the boat and venture across the engineered canal, you may learn how the waterway travels 50 miles and opens faster and safer trade routes between the Atlantic and Pacific oceans. At the Miraflores Locks, you can watch the walls sink as the water rises to 54 feet, elevating the boat to help it pass comfortably between oceans.

dayInfo.title: Boquete - Tour Old Panama and Travel to Boquete
dayInfo.description: Before leaving Panama City for the highlands of Boquete, you will have a morning guided tour winding along the cobblestone streets of the antique neighborhood known as Casco Viejo. The historic ambiance exudes from the architectural style and aesthetics as you visit highlights like the 17th-century Plaza Bolivar and the narrow streets leading away from the public square. Witness the climbing bell towers of the Catedral Metropolitana or enter into the remains of the 18th-century Iglesia y Convento de la Compania de Jesus, which can feel like a quiet escape when wandering through the nooks offering shade from the tropical sun. In the afternoon, your transfer will take you to the airport for your brief flight to Boquete, where you can relax in the remote quiet of the mountainous landscape.

dayInfo.title: Boquete - Experience Adventure and Flavor in the Highlands
dayInfo.description: Boquete is a land of waterfalls and coffee plantations, dense cloud forest canopies, and majestic waterfalls. Venture out into meandering trails crisscrossing the rolling terrain with a tour along the hanging bridges. The cool morning mist can give you insight into how the cloud forest thrives in the moisture, with flora and fauna preferring the colder climate beneath the 11,400-foot tall peak of Volcán Barú. Enjoy the view of treetops among the variety of hanging bridges connecting the trails and search for the sulfur-winged parakeets or dozens of hummingbird species known to feed heavily on the blossoming flowers. After embracing the treetops, you have the option of indulging in the local tastes of coffee with a plantation tour, learning how the volcanic soil and temperate climate impact the flavor as your guide takes you through the growing and roasting techniques before offering a sample that may result in fruity notes of berry, citrus, and mango.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Discover Island Life in Panama
dayInfo.description: Your transfer will meet you at the hotel and escort you to the airport for your flight to Bocas del Toro and your continued boat ride to Isla Bastimentos. While the island may be physically close to the main town, it can feel like a world away, where palm-fringed beaches and turtle nesting grounds overlook untouched coral reefs and the protected expanse of Parque Nacional Marino Isla Bastimentos. Take your time to relax as you settle into the remote and welcoming environment of the tropical island setting. You may find a small beach connected to your resort where you can sink your toes into the warm, soft sands and listen to the water lap against the island shore.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Revel in an Island Day at Leisure
dayInfo.description: With the day at leisure, you can relax on the coastline with the soothing waters and the dense forest as a backdrop to your tropical lifestyle. You can listen to the Atlantic Ocean or feel the golden sunlight spreading across your skin. You could take to the island's natural wonders by visiting Nivida Bat Cave, where you can find a large collection of nectar bats near the shores of a subterranean lake. During a guided tour, you can wind through the channel bordered by mangrove trees and listen to the sounds of wildlife, giving you a quintessential jungle atmosphere.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Delight in Your Choice of Beach Adventure
dayInfo.description: With another day at leisure on the island, you can continue embracing beach life on sheltered coves or take to the waters on a sailing excursion bound for coral gardens and remote islands. Your excursion may take you to Cayo Coral, a small island between Isla Bastimentos and Isla Popa, offering crystal-clear shelter from the open ocean. You can dive down and enjoy the views of the coral, reaching up to 12 feet deep with golden sponges surrounded by queen angelfish or seagrass hiding stoplight parrotfish. Time can slow down as you enjoy exploring the marine life, colors, and gentle sway of the water.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Explore More of Panama City
dayInfo.description: When you are ready, your transfer will take you to the airport for your flight back to Panama City. You can relax in your accommodation near the city center before exploring new corners or returning to your favorite spaces for the remainder of the day. You can spend time at the Museum of Biodiversity to view the exhibits sharing the incredible natural history for which Panama is known. Renowned architect Frank Gehry designed the structure, and the interior demonstrates the importance of Panama’s location as the bridge between continents, sharing elements of the Americas, North and South.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: Panama City feels cosmopolitan, and in the morning, the aromas of delectable Panamanian coffee often drift through the narrow streets of Casco Viejo alongside the scents of pineapple or rambutan. If you have time, you may choose to walk through the streets once more to enjoy the city’s unique culture and style before meeting your private transfer bound for the airport. Your highlights tour of Panama will come to an end when you board your plane bound for home, but you could always extend your adventure in Central America.

placesVisited: Panama City, Bocas del Toro, Isla Colón
generalInfo: Experience an unforgettable vacation with your children when embarking on an 8-day family-friendly Panama tour. Discover dramatic canals, breathtaking island beaches and the dangling vines and lianas of mangrove glades. Enjoy wildlife encounters that will introduce you and your kids to unusual creatures such as the Panamanian golden frog and fun favorites like the slow but sleek sloth creating the ultimate Panama adventure for you and your family.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Explore Soaring Skylines and Beautiful Beaches
dayInfo.description: Embrace the wonders of Panama City as you and your family wander the city center. Towering buildings line the way for a diverse architectural exploration, while twisted towers lead the way to vast sandy beaches. Discover the family-friendly neighborhood of Amador by bicycle with a ride along the rustic-colored Amador Causeway, admiring the blue-green waters blurring by you. Step inside the Amador Biomuseo, the roof of multi-colored squares resembling haphazardly-placed post-it notes in contrast to its lush green gardens. Kids of all ages can explore the history of Panama and experience exhibitions such as the ‘living web,’ a 50-foot living sculpture that presents the interconnectedness of plant life, animals, and microorganisms.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Learn the Intricate Workings of Panama’s Locks
dayInfo.description: A day of adventure awaits your family as you set sail to the entrance of the Panama Canal. The Bay of Panama will guide you as the city skyline fades in the distance as you enter the first of two locks. The intriguing and perfectly-timed engineering marvel offers a functional purpose as well as a fascinating and fun geographical exploration. Thunderous white walls of water plummet into rising waters, your vessel seemingly floating up toward the sky. Crossing the calm and shimmering waters of the Miraflores Lake, the rumbling of Pedro Miguel Lock opens you to the snaking Culebra Cut, revealing a day of water wonders and intricate engineering as you enjoy the crisp, cool brush of water drops against your skin.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Set Sail for a Wildlife Sanctuary
dayInfo.description: Mimicking monkeys, sleek-like sloths, and the majestic brilliance of butterflies are all on the list of exciting encounters you and your family can enjoy today. Set sail on Gatun Lake, the emerald waters of this freshwater lake carrying a myriad of ships across the Isthmus of Panama, moving you through tropical forest and lush vegetation to Monkey Island. Giggle at the cute, yet cheeky facial gestures of the white-faced capuchin monkey, small in stature, large in attitude. Watch with bated breath as the two-toed sloth hangs suspended from a trusting branch, the hairy creature going nowhere in a hurry, and admire the beauty of butterflies flickering through orchid-filled rainforests.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Discover Exotic Mangroves and Island Bliss
dayInfo.description: Travel west to the island paradise of Isla Colon in the Bocas del Toro archipelago. Your adventure begins when you step aboard your tender boat, almost parallel to the water. Gaze upon exotic mangrove glades as straggling vines create a curtain-like effect over thick shrubs and trees, the waters lapping against sandy banks. Draw back the vine curtain to reveal an exquisite picture of a white sandy beach separating azure waters from deep green forests with dramatic views across the Caribbean waters as you settle down in a haven far removed from the bustling city scenes.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Embark on a Hiking Island Adventure
dayInfo.description: A mix of downtime and island adventure awaits islanders of all ages today. The region beckons families to explore the breathtaking combination of pristine white beaches and lush rainforests. Start your hike from Salt Creek, a humble village and quiet community of fishermen and tradesmen. As you walk through mangrove glades and along quiet creeks, listen to how the jungle journey offers a cacophony of shrills and calls. Pause for a while to get acquainted with the history and traditions of the Ngabe Bugle tribe and watch an artist paint a Guaymi painting, shapes and colors contrasting your natural surroundings.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Delight in Marine Life or Tasty Cacao Bites
dayInfo.description: Embrace island life with many activities and adventures during your day at leisure in Bocas del Toro. Take to the water to watch graceful dolphins frolicking in the waves off Dolphin Bay, creating perfect archways as they leap in the air, or perhaps little explorers may find seeking orange and pink starfish lining the sandy bottom of shallow waters a fascinating way to spend their day on a Zapatilla Cays beach. Switch gears with a visit to a cacao plantation near Almirante to learn how the simple yet powerful cocoa bean is transformed into a delicious chocolate treat. Savor smooth textures with coconut notes on the palate, perhaps the sweet swirl of caramel melting in your mouth.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Uncover Historical Casco Antiguo Neighborhood
dayInfo.description: Uncover a different neighborhood of Panama City today when you bid farewell to your island paradise and embrace the historical and UNESCO Cultural World Heritage Site of Casco Antiguo. Art and culture run through the cobbled streets between boutique hotels and bakeries, family eateries, and culinary corners. Take some time to savor a plate of delicious, smooth calamari rings or bite into soft and powdery mamallena dessert, the doughy balls a delight with each bite. Dine under the stars on a rooftop bar in Cathedral Square with views over the Museum Canal while the distant city skyline fades to dark as sounds of lively Panamanian music fill the night.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Take One Last Glance Over the Panama Canal
dayInfo.description: In the morning, enjoy one more breakfast savoring your view of the towering buildings and beyond to the waters of the Bay of Panama. Look out in the distance and admire boats large and small as they slowly crawl along the Panama Canal. Admire the silver curve of the Bridge of Americas, spanning the Panama Canal’s Pacific entrance, and capture one more mental snapshot of Panama City’s pristine beaches before returning home from your Panamanian adventure with your transfer to the airport.

tourName: Panama Adventure Tour: Ziplining, Sailing, and Wildlife
placesVisited: Panama City, Monkey Island, Boquete, Boca Chia, Gulf of Chiriqui
generalInfo: Find vibrant life and endless possibilities on your 8-day Panama Adventure vacation. From delving into the past as you stroll antique streets to immersing yourself in the sounds and aromas of the tropical jungle, diving into pristine turquoise waters to explore coral gardens to venturing into the lush trees in search of wildlife, Panama’s limitless surprises will encourage new discoveries and unforgettable experiences throughout your custom-tailored trip.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Arrive in Incredible Panama
dayInfo.description: Panama City is a place of glamour and modernity fringed by glimpses into untamed nature and connections to remote beaches. Marvels of contemporary engineering demonstrate a faster pace of life among the antique and newer neighborhoods where high-rises can overlook colonial ruins. Your private transfer will meet you at the Tocumen International Airport customs and escort you to the comfort of your accommodations, where you can begin your adventure. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to settle into the city and embrace the new ambiance. You may choose to stroll along Paseo de las Bovedas to enjoy overlooking the historic seawall and listening to the vendors chatting as they display artisan crafts set beneath the flowering bougainvillea.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Explore the Wildlife Wonders of Panama
dayInfo.description: You may wake up to a sunny tropical morning in Panama City, where the sunlight washes over the colorful facades of Casco Viejo, the old neighborhood. Set out with your guide on an exciting tour to explore the wilderness within arm’s reach of the urban streets, first with a boat tour to visit Monkey Island. The small island seems to float in Lake Gatun, shines with foliage, and sings with the active calls of white-faced capuchin, Geoggroy’s tamarin, and howler monkeys. You may feel the monkeys watching you as you approach and wander along the jungle terrain, stepping over vines or rustling the leaves. You can continue to a sloth sanctuary to learn more about the slow-moving mammal, its camouflaged fur, and how the sanctuary is helping protect and preserve the wilderness.

dayInfo.title: Boquete - Visit the Panama Canal and Travel to Boquete
dayInfo.description: Start your day with an exciting exploration of the Panama Canal at the Miraflores Locks, one of the three locks that form the world-renowned canal. The engineered waterway is over 100 years old and is celebrated for opening up faster and safer trade routes between the Atlantic and Pacific oceans. At Miraflores, you can witness the quality and vision of engineering on a ship as it rises over 54 feet. You will not only feel the ship moving but may also witness the walls sinking as the water rises. Before transferring to the stunning highlands at Boquete, you will continue to Casco Viejo, where the city’s history comes to life among the narrow streets and colorful buildings. Walk between historic ruins and enjoy the views spreading out to the bay, accentuated by the sleek design of the modern city. You may feel you’ve stepped back in time as you witness architectural designs dating back to the 17th century.

dayInfo.title: Boquete - Discover Panama��’s Treetops
dayInfo.description: Panama’s highlands are an exciting place, where the hum of waterfalls and buzz of hummingbirds feels only steps away. As you discover more of Boquete and the surrounding terrain, you can visit the hanging bridges for a different view of the dense cloud forest. The collection of bridges can reach up to 246 feet above the forest floor, where the treetops spring into activity with birds and wildlife. Enjoy the collection of trails as you search the quiet forest for signs of resplendent quetzal, whose iridescent red plumage can stand out from the background of emerald leaves. You can continue your adventure through the treetops with a zipline excursion, embracing the feeling of flying through the canopy.

dayInfo.title: Boca Chica - Travel to the Sensational Oceanside
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will escort you to the airport after breakfast for your flight to David, where you will continue to the stunning combination of tropical wildlife and coastline at Boca Chica. Set near the border of Costa Rica and situated close to islands protected by a national marine park, arrive in Boca Chica with time to relax and recharge before heading back into the limitless adventures of Panama. You can bask in the feeling of an undiscovered gem as the ocean breeze drives through town and the water glows transparent beneath the golden sunlight. Boats may return from time on the Pacific Ocean with fresh fish or visitors who enjoyed time scuba diving amongst the vibrant marine life. You may find parrots perched in trees or listen to howler monkeys calling to one another in the distance.

dayInfo.title: Boca Chica - Embrace Tropical Waters and Islands
dayInfo.description: Step onto a boat and enjoy an immersion in a tropical fantasy. Sail among the islands of the Gulf of Chiriqui and the Chiriqui National Marine Park and embrace the cool breeze and aroma of the Pacific as the views of white-sand beaches shaped like crescents and bordered with palm trees come into view. During the season, you may have sightings of humpback whales passing Panama as they migrate away from the Southern Sea. The boat will drop anchor for a chance to plunge into the water for a snorkeling excursion. You may find signs of sea turtles grazing in the warm and welcoming waters among pockets of bright coral and waving sea grass.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Return to Panama City
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you may have time to enjoy the Pacific and white-sand beaches of Boca Chica and its surroundings once more before returning to Panama City. Spend time kayaking or basking in the view of the coastline before meeting your private transfer and flying back to the city. After settling into your accommodations, the day is at your leisure. You can return to Casco Viejo to walk beneath the towers of Iglesia y Convento de la Compania de Jesus or spend more time in Panama Viejo to explore the 14 remaining ruins dating back to the 16th century. The Panama Canal Museum also offers a great perspective on the history and importance of the canal for Panama and the world.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: Throughout the day, you may find local Panamanians sitting in outdoor cafes, sipping coffee, and enjoying as time passes by. In the morning, you may find the aroma of roasted beans from the celebrated coffee produced in Panama’s highlands. When you are ready, your private transfer will meet you in the hotel lobby and escort you to the airport for your flight home, ending your exceptional Panama adventure. You can always extend your trip to explore more of the country or continue north to Costa Rica or south to Colombia to further embrace the spirit of adventure.

tourName: Romantic Panama Honeymoon Vacation: Tropical Beaches, Boat Excursion, Wildlife & More
placesVisited: Panama City, Gulf of Chiriqui, Isla Palenque, Monkey Island
generalInfo: Your 8-day Panama honeymoon vacation is an immersion into a tropical fantasy. Relax on pristine beaches on a secluded island, embrace the treasured charms of colonial architecture, and bask in natural beauty during an island-hopping excursion. From coastal beauty to luxurious accommodations, secret hiking trails to dreamy coral gardens, you will create everlasting memories with your enchanting honeymoon in Panama.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Arrive in a Tropical Romantic Ambiance
dayInfo.description: Panama City has a romantic touch, with greenery thriving among the protected corners that edge the city’s borders. Preserved colonial architecture offers colorful facades lining the streets of Casco Viejo, the historic neighborhood. Upon arrival, your transfer will meet you at the airport and escort you to the comforts of your centrally located accommodations. Settle into the city at your leisure and take your time getting comfortable, from visiting the shoreline to walking along the Paseo de las Bóvedas, the old seawall known for the briny scent of the sea breeze, the vibrant artisan crafts sold by vendors along the lane, and views of Downtown’s shimmering glass high-rises.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Explore the Wonders of Panama City
dayInfo.description: The tropical ambiance of Panama City can feel captivating, immersing you in the combination of natural beauty and civil wonder as you make your way to the Panama Canal at the Miraflores Locks. The engineering marvel spans over 50 miles long, with waters rising to nearly 65 feet, depending on the tides. You may board a vessel as it travels through the locks to experience a portion of the Panama Canal and see how it has made trade more accessible and faster between the Atlantic and Pacific. You may continue to Monkey Island and enjoy the lush foliage, quiet waters, and boisterous sounds of four species of monkeys populating the island. You may see white-faced capuchin monkeys moving through the trees or listen to the guttural call of howler monkeys hidden in the canopy.

dayInfo.title: Isla Palenque - Embrace Island Luxuries and Seclusio
dayInfo.description: Isla Palenque promises the ideal romance on a secluded island as part of the Boca Chica archipelago. Your transfer will meet you at the hotel in the morning and escort you to the airport. The boat ride along the waters of the Gulf of Chiriqui will open your eyes to the crystal-clear azure waters of the Pacific before you change to a panorama of towering palm trees and golden sands of your tropical island paradise. Relax in the comforting breeze rustling the palm fronds and the aroma of the sea. The water laps at the coastline and sustainability becomes a luxurious practice with your accommodation’s position far from the bustle of more developed towns.

dayInfo.title: Isla Palenque - Delight in the Island at Your Leisure
dayInfo.description: Embrace the dream-like beauty of your island paradise with a day at leisure. Spend time exploring the waters or lounging on the soft sands among the seven celebrated beaches for which the island is known. If you and your partner prefer the sound of crashing waves and the quiet of an isolated corner, you can visit the tidal pools at Cala Este or listen for toucans and parrots in the lush jungle canopy as you lounge on the warm sands. You may be able to partake in a romantic seaside picnic for an intimate and unforgettable oceanside moment. Dip your toes into the cool water for a refreshing change before returning to your resort or continuing on to Playa Catalina for a kayaking excursion on the island’s calmest bay.

dayInfo.title: Isla Palenque - Search for Life Beneath the Waves
dayInfo.description: You can return to the beach and venture further into the water with a guided snorkel tour around the Gulf of Chiriqui. The protected marine park spreads across more than 34,500 acres providing refuge for coral reefs, mangrove forests, sea turtles, and migrating whales. As you sail, the mixture of sunlight and sea breeze can create perfect conditions against the backdrop of passing islands. The boat may weigh anchor at the edge of a coral garden where you can dive into the water in search of sea turtles feeding on the waving sea grass or pods of dolphins passing in the distance.

dayInfo.title: Isla Palenque - Further Explore your Majestic Island
dayInfo.description: The wonders of Isla Palenque will continue to mesmerize you with another day at your leisure to explore at your pace. You may choose to return to the beaches, take another kayak excursion along the shoreline, or set out into the island interior to follow the jungle trails that expose a secret side of the island. Enjoy a tour with a guide to travel through the maze of primary forests to reveal a different perspective of tropical beauty. Listen to stories of folklore, learning how the islands came into being as you uncover touches of community history dating back centuries while also finding stunning panoramas of the coastline.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Return to Panama City
dayInfo.description: With so many wonderful experiences to enjoy on Isla Palenque, it may be challenging to return to the faster pace of Panama City. If you have time, you may choose to enjoy a whale watching tour, setting out into the water with your guide, this time in search of some of the best places to glimpse the pods of humpback whales bursting clouds of spray up to three-feet high or breaching out of the water and crashing down with an incredible splash. When you return to the city, your transfer will escort you to your accommodation, where you can relax or explore at your pace for the remainder of the day.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: You may find the aromas of Panamanian coffee drifting out of the cafes in the morning or the scent of traditional cookies known as orejitas emerging from the bakeries around sunrise. Your transfer will greet you in the hotel lobby when you are ready and escort you to the international airport for your flight home. You can always extend your time in Panama or further explore Central America's charms, romance, and beauty.

tourName: Ultimate Panama Vacation for Seniors: Nature Trails & Remote Beaches
placesVisited: Panama City, Monkey Island, Boquete, Isla Colon, Bocas del Toro, Isla Bastimentos
generalInfo: A destination brimming with culture, natural beauty, and significant world heritage, your 11-day Panama vacation for seniors paints a colorful picture with a once-in-a-lifetime adventure. Discover a contrasting city with Old World charm overlapping with modern-day vitality. Wander through natural playgrounds that range from mangrove glades to coffee plantations to waterfalls to breathtaking beaches. Combine activity with downtime as you make your way through the beauty and wonder of Panama.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Discover a Destination of Culture and Charm
dayInfo.description: Arriving in Panama City, your journey of heritage discovery, cultural charm, and artistic wonder begins from the moment you arrive. Embrace the warm welcome and charm of your local guide when you are met at the airport and travel to the old town neighborhood of Casco Viejo, a quiet and charming location within the city. Take your time roaming through the brown-and-white stoned Metropolitan Cathedral or wander the narrow cobbled lanes of Casco Antiguo, shaded by leaning palm trees where you can stop to enjoy a fruity and full-flavored Panamanian coffee. Settle into your new accommodations and embrace Panama’s friendly hospitality.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Embark on a Journey Down Causeways
dayInfo.description: Colonial charm meets modern architecture as you travel from the old town of Casco Antiguo, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, to the plazas and towering skyline of modern Panama City. Listen to the buzz of local traffic as you weave through cars when you drive to the popular Amador Causeway. Notice how the road seems to disappear into the canal in the distance, as views of the emerald waters command a feeling of calm. Take in the picturesque scene of the perfectly-spaced wrought iron lamp posts that line the rusty-painted promenade.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Wander Through a Nature Sanctuary
dayInfo.description: Step away from the concrete jungle and into a natural jungle of wondrous wildlife on Monkey Island. Admire the natural beauty of the lush vegetation alongside the famous Panama Canal as you travel to Monkey Island. Capture the barking sound of the howler monkey and look out for the brightly orange-colored beak of the toucan as he takes cover in a leafy tree. With accessible pathways and spots to stop and rest if the mood suits you, wander the rainforest floor at your own pace. Brighten your experience with the sight of the Blue Morpho Butterfly fluttering amid blooming orchids or catching a glimpse of the tiny strawberry poison frog.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Cruise the Panama Canal
dayInfo.description: Take to the waters of the Panama Canal and experience the engineering marvel of vessels maneuvering through locks, the chambers of water rolling to the top of the waterway. As you float to the surface, take in boats in front and behind you, the string of vessels resembling a string of ornaments on a beveled surface. Glide across the fresh waters of Miraflores Lake before entering Pedro Miguel lock. Snake your way through the Continental Divide as you sail across the Culebra Cut, a significant geological site marking the lowest point in the mountain system that runs from Alaska to Chile.

dayInfo.title: Boquete - Laze in Lush Rainforests and Savor Arabigo Coffee
dayInfo.description: Take a short flight over lush rainforests to the lowland city of David, then transfer by road to Boquete, a scenic town nestled on the brim of picturesque Baru Volcano National Park. Absorb the stillness in the air and coolness of the atmosphere as you embrace splashes of vibrant green valleys merging with dense treelines and babbling brooks. Take time to sit and savor the rich, volcanic-inspired coffee produced in the region, the dark hues of the beans offering a fruity flavor while hints of caramel and jasmine fill the air. Your guide will help you discover the science of creating the perfect cup of coffee, from bean selection to roasting and brewing.

dayInfo.title: Boquete - Hike Nature Trails and Discover Misty Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: Take an active step towards sheer beauty and tranquility. Paradise awaits and is accessible to hikers of all fitness levels as you embark on an excursion through the cloud forest, along croaking creeks and culminating in a trio of majestic waterfalls. Watch the white wall of splashing waters fall into an emerald pool. Carefully step towards cozy caves, keeping an ear and eye out for tropical birds, such as the rose-throated becard or the crimson-fronted parakeet. Bathe in the warm waters of the caldera hot springs, the pools of which offer a soothing and healing energy as you embrace your day of wondrous adventure in nature’s breathtaking garden.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Traverse Mountain Passes and Mangrove Glades
dayInfo.description: Explore new heights today with a drive through the mountains of Cordillera de Talamanca, where canopies of evergreen oaks cover montane forests that sweep across the dramatic mountainside. Breathe in the fresh mountain air as you descend to sea level, the changing snapshots of the Caribbean coast’s panorama. Reach Amirante, bustling with water taxis carrying visitors to Isla Colon, the gateway to the beautiful islands of Boca del Toro. Enjoy the stillness of your surroundings as your boat glides through intriguing mangrove glades. View the hanging vines tumbling down from the top of the bushy trees like curtains of the forest. Listen as your guide points out the sounds of the Panamanian chirping frog ringing out through the trickling silence of the swamps.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Laze in Turquoise Waters and On Remote Beaches
dayInfo.description: Active seniors may wish to explore the rural and remote town of Bastimentos, an island destination comprising mostly remote, wild landscapes. Choose to explore the village amid breathtaking beaches and mangrove forests, or you might want to explore the Cayos Zapatillas islands located in the Bastimentos National Marine Park, two picturesque and idyllic havens of brilliant white beaches and thick dark green trees surrounded by crystal clear teal waters. Snorkel colorful coral reefs or traverse the landmass by kayak. Watch sea turtles at play, step over fascinating starfish, and step inside the jungle to see lazy sloths hanging about.

dayInfo.title: Bocas del Toro - Enjoy a Day of Active Adventure and Discovery
dayInfo.description: For senior travelers looking to explore the active side of an idyllic archipelago, Bocas del Toro is a playground of adventure and discovery. The options are endless, from thrilling ziplining to a gentle hike to exploring a bat cave. You can turn your adventure into a flavor discovery with a cacao farm tour. Tantalize your sweet tooth and taste buds as you walk through a cacao plantation, your guide describing the production process, from planting to harvesting to creating the rich and creamy or dark and tart chocolate treats you will get to taste later. Use your sense of smell to identify the ideal, sweet aroma of the perfect cacao bean.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Wander a City of Skyscrapers and Promenades
dayInfo.description: Uncover the contrasting features of Panama’s capital, diverse architecture comprising twisting and reaching modern skyscrapers highlighting the city’s financial district’s skyline with the Old Town’s humble yet striking red-roofed abodes. Take a walk through cobbled lanes, antique stores set amid coffee shops and perfumeries, a blend of rich aromas and sweet scents mixing in the air. Get a taste of Spanish Panama when visiting Via Argentina, the savory smell of saffron inviting you to taste local paella or perhaps enjoy a hearty sancocho soup, rich in the flavor of crunchy vegetables and flavorsome meat.

dayInfo.title: Panama City - Farewell to a City of Contrasts
dayInfo.description: Spend a few hours bidding this city of wonder farewell. If time permits, consider taking a stroll or enjoying a bicycle ride along the Amador Causeway as you watch ships passing under the Bridge of Americas in the distance. Glace over at the city’s coastline, soft sandy beaches that seem to sprawl from concrete and brick and disappear into a green gulf.
